entries.meaning: (Scotland, Ireland, Northern England, dialect) The act of ploutering, or splashing about.

verbs.description: plouter (third-person singular simple present plouters, present participle ploutering, simple past and past participle ploutered)

entries.meaning: (Scotland, Ireland, Northern England, dialect) To splash around in something wet; to dabble.
(Scotland, Ireland, Northern England, dialect) To potter.
examples: So one night after they had all had supper in the kitchen and old Sinclair had gone pleitering out to the byres, old Mistress Sinclair had up and nodded to Kirsty […].
